google_play_reviews.content: By far the best rss reader and literally blows all else out of the water that are available on Playstore and f-droid, it's actively maintained on github and f-droid so go there for the updated version. The dev is very responsive on github to any suggestions and issues and puts out updates very regularly in beta. Eventually pushing to stable in github/f-droid. Google is actively preventing this dev from being able to update the app on the Google Play Store due to political conflict in the world.
It's very good, fast and easy to choose sources since I don't have any page links... Even though it does notifications it doesn't bring the actual articles to the notification area
Old articles keep coming. Please fix it.

UPDATE: Upgrading to 0.17.1 did not resolve issues. (Thank you for the "load full article" tip - it worked) ORIGINAL: Nice fork of Flym. However, article icons do not appear in Article List until after I interact with an article. Additionally, Tap Zones in Article List remain in place when disabled. HNR 0.16.20+, Android 9.0
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You can set load full text check box in custom feed setup

google_play_reviews.content: The best RSS Offline news reader. Using it since 2 years and it has never failed me. Best feature is the manipulation of the html filter to get a perfect output of the scraped pages.

No way to load article icon thumbnails? I really wanted to like this RSS feed app. It seems to have the most settings of any free RSS feed app right now, however there doesn't seem to be any way to have an article image/icon show in the RSS feed list. I tried posting questions on how to fix it, no response. I tried pouring over all the settings, no luck. If there is some way to have icons show in the RSS feed list it's not clear how that's possible and so I won't be keeping this app.
I love this app. But upon every refresh the app loads old news feeds. Please add an option to limit feed download for a particular time period.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Long tap on the feed in feed list and setup Custom articles keep time

google_play_reviews.content: Very good! Just to add an option change the fonts.

Perfect, it is fast at updates, the app works logically, it is very customisable, but also works out of the box. Importing/exporting is also seamless. The app does a very good job at handling news articles and is very user friendly.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please describe what app features are valuable for you.

google_play_reviews.content: Very handy indeed. Although the app's icons are not beautiful at all, HNR is a very good offline feed reader.
Had a number of bugs. But the worst part is that the article text is not displayed properly. Duplicated pictures and text.

Love the app for allowing to create notifications for news via RSS, especially those who want to catch it at the first minute or so. However, making it showing pop-up and sound notifications will occassionally show a "Refreshing feed" or something similar notification that will lead to notifications being made without any news. Would be nice if the notification feature to be tweaked a bit better, at least doesn't create notification until there's actual news.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: That notification is demanded by Android to allow the app work in background (to update feeds automatically).

google_play_reviews.content: Super but, I am using handy news reader, rss feed refresh only 20 articles display, but feed articles more than 43, please say the solution, how 1 refresh get all articles display
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Try select Delete all in article list menu and refresh again

google_play_reviews.content: Downloads thousands of pictures without any way to stop it! There was over 2,000 pictures downloaded from this app, as well as a thousand more thumbnails! Simply unacceptable and it needs fixed. Reading news stories doesn't mean I want pictures downloaded on my phone, just display the pictures, don't download them!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You can setup to load or not images during auto refresh per feed. Long tap in feed, auto load images checkbox. Go to settings, automatic refresh and select Never in Preload images

google_play_reviews.content: almost the best rss reader. only need is auto mark article is read by scoll to next article edit: since it already have filter function,. could you add auto alert feature when fetched some key words articles. ie., I can get alert when a deal comes thank you very much for this great app the filter only has 3 options, accept, reject and star. but I don't want every time I star an item get an alert --- thank you very much. I have thousands news every day, click one by one to mark read is too hard.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Your are welcome to https://github.com/yanus171/Handy-News-Reader/issues to create an issue where we can discuss it

google_play_reviews.content: Nice app although I would like more features; I mailed the developer, he's very helpful and really helpful replies quickly. Regularly updated so I'm looking forward to its development!

Dear Sir thanks for adding save/restore feature in this app. This feature is very much important above all. In your next update pls add a feature so that i can delete all the read articles from "All Article" tab of your app. Point to be noted that "delete all" option present in your app does not working which is currently provided in "All article" tab.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: OK. It will be nice if you add such an issue on github, so we can discuss it there

google_play_reviews.content: nice concept, and I like the download feature. but it crashes constantly on my pixelbook. cannot see more than two articles before it crashes again
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Mail me the file /storage/emulated.../feedex/crash.txt and even better open the corresponding issue on github https://github.com/yanus171/Flym/issues
